climbs.name: Oliver Clark's Great Chewbacca Warrior Spirit Traverse

content.description:
Start on the right hand side of the rock, so you will traverse upstream. Start on a right-facing sidepull, and move left following the natural line. Cross the crack for a quick shake, and chalk. Stay low, and follow the sharp crimpers. After a few moves, you come to the crux, which has delicate foot work, and work to a left-facing flake. Move up from here to nearly perfect, incut crimps. Continue traversing left, and a short down climb will complete this traverse. This rock is sharp...like life, and one will have to persevere. There are lots of half pad and full pads crimps on here.

This was named after Oliver and his fighting warrior spirit.
content.protection: One or two pads near the crux should do it.
content.location: A Fraternal Twins Boulder, start at the right side.

content.description: Eleanor "Snuggs" starts on a decent two handed crimp/pinch followed by quality movement over more crimps. Top out or downclimb at the top of the triangle with the crack to the right.
Start at the dirty crack that goes up to the left. Either use just the crack or the holds outside of the crack. Top out or downclimb. End at the obvious triangle at the shaped rock.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter would be a great set up. I used a 1 full and 1/2 pad with no spotter.
content.location: Locate the left-leaning, obvious crack on the wall.

content.description: Amelia Bean starts with a two hand sharp crimp (crux) followed by great movement and great crimps. It will clean up with more traffic. The upper holds are picture perfect crimps. Top out or downclimb. This has solid holds.
content.protection: A full pad. It has perfect landings.
content.location: Two handed crimp just to the east aka right of the first route.

pathTokens: North Fork of the St. Vrain River
